summary: Tsushima Island, part of the Japanese archipelago, lies between Kyushu and the Korean Peninsula. Once a single island, it's now divided into two main parts by canals, creating North and South Tsushima. There are also over 100 smaller islands in the Tsushima archipelago. Administratively, it belongs to Nagasaki Prefecture. The island group is about 70 km by 15 km and had around 28,000 residents as of 2022. The main islands are the largest satellite island group in Nagasaki and the eighth-largest in Japan. The city of Tsushima, Nagasaki is divided into six boroughs.
title: Tsushima Island
